title: Barry Andrews (rugby league)
text:
Barry Andrews (born in 1950) is a former professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played for <a href="Cronulla-Sutherland%20Sharks">Cronulla-Sutherland</a> and <a href="Sydney%20Roosters">Eastern Suburbs</a> in the <a href="New%20South%20Wales%20Rugby%20League">New South Wales Rugby League</a> (NSWRL) competition.
Playing career.
Barry Andrews, a five-eight and prolific goal-kicker, played nine seasons with <a href="Cronulla-Sutherland%20Sharks">Cronulla-Sutherland</a> between 1971-1979 and is the fourth highest points scorer for the club. Nicknamed 'Panda', he is currently the 5th highest first grade scorer with 657 points.
He was a member of the <a href="Cronulla%20Sharks">Cronulla Sharks</a> grand final team that drew the <a href="1978%20NSWRFL%20season">1978 Grand Final</a> against <a href="Manly-Warringah%20Sea%20Eagles">Manly-Warringah Sea Eagles</a>, 11 points all. He did not play in the grand final replay due to injury.
He finished his career with <a href="Sydney%20Roosters">Eastern Suburbs</a> in 1980.
